intro: Weigela decora var. decora, commonly known as the showy weigela, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features upright growth with dense, branching stems that produce vibrant, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. The flowers bloom in early summer, adding ornamental value to the landscape.
